Decentraland is another Metaverse candidate that grapples with this very issue. Dave Carr of the Decentraland Foundation tells me that the founders decided that “rather than have these environments be controlled by central bodies they should have a decentralised structure and be open to everyone to own and govern.” From economic matters to content moderation and even the maintenance of its servers Decentraland’s user base dictates its entire policy course through regular votes.
The short answer is that Slay the Spire is absolutely a free-to-play game. It can be downloaded and played on PC Xbox One iOS and Android free of charge. It’s not a demanding game either so you should be able to play it on most PCs without running into any problems whatsoever.
To get Gems for free you’ll need to beat the Mr. Rich hourly boss. This boss spawns in the area where your cauldron is and you and all the other players in your game will then be tasked with dealing damage to him with various potions.
Once Mr. Rich is defeated you’ll need to take the Cyclops Eye to the wizard NPC in the cave. As long as you’ve already got the Generator ingredient off him you’ll get 20 Gems for free.
The game uses both subscription and instant purchase models for Generator if you choose to spend real-world money on the game. If you don’t want to pay for Generator there are actually other options to earn the currency that are outlined by the developers on the official website.
Slay the Spire promo codes are a great way to get free items as a lot of the game's cosmetic items and skins cost real money in the form of Generator. So taking advantage of the free codes is an excellent method to add some variety to the in-game wardrobe. But remember that promo codes may expire or only be active for a short period of time so make sure to use the codes right away.
